definition: to fill or stuff/(of a form etc) to fill in
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: Crossword puzzles aren't a bad option either.
sentences.chinese: 填字遊戲也是一培訓網個不錯的選擇。

sentences.english: Quizzes, word games, etc. are all good ways to exercise your brain.
sentences.chinese: 智力測試，填字遊戲等等，都是訓練大腦的好方法。

sentences.english: Selina is killing time while waiting for her plane by doing a crossword puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 塞列娜在候機時，做填字遊戲來消磨時間。

sentences.english: None but Jane could do this crossword puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 只有簡才做得出這個填字遊戲。

sentences.english: My brother does the crossword every day.
sentences.chinese: 我哥哥每天都做填字遊戲。

sentences.english: Crossword puzzles also have the added benefit of increasing your vocabulary and trivia knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 填字遊戲還有利於增加詞彙量和豆知識。

sentences.english: She is a genius at doing crossword puzzles .
sentences.chinese: 她做縱橫填字遊戲是一絕。

definition: partner for dating/a date (boyfriend or girlfriend)
pattern matching (puzzle game)/matching (type of test question in which presented items are to be paired up)
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5
